definition[0]: relating to profits after EXCEPTIONAL ITEMS (=profits and losses that are made in a particular period of time but do not occur regularly) have been taken into account
example[0]: Provisions on doubtful property loans taken below the line reduced taxable profits to £3.95 million.
definition[1]: relating to a company’s spending on marketing activities other than advertising, for example research
example[1]: Agencies offer strategic advice as well as below the line services like market research, pack design and direct marketing.
